content.description: Short and sweet. Start on a small ledge about face height. Make your way up, over the lip and to glory. Set sail!
content.protection: 2 pads..1 for neighboring sloped rock, and another for the base.
content.location: About 10' to the left of Full Sail. Nestled in slot between the Unsinkable boulder and boulder to south.

content.description:
Start on two slightly left facing crimps and pull off the ground (be carful not to rest your hip on the boulder to your right). You'll hit a number of edges that trend in an arc to the right before cutting back left. The crux may be not dabbing your feet on the crash pad behind you higher up on a dynamic move near the top out.

 I think as the rock cleans up a bit this line will be a great contribution to the area! I was able to clear most of the choss but have a feeling some more small pebbles will break with use. Definitely worth giving a go, will be an even better climb as it cleans up with a little traffic.
content.protection: Used two and a half crash pads for cozy protection. Could be done with just 2 fairly easily.

content.description: The boulder runs parallel another small boulder making falls delightfully small with an enjoyable slide to help cope with the disappointment of blowing the send.
